-r00eKH8xe8B1NR7-0hwVA.text: We went to see Terry Fator's show and thought we would enjoy dinner after the show at the Mirage.  David got 1/2 dozen oysters that were ok.  We split a bone in strip steak which first came out luke I warm.  The sides were also not hot.  We got the mushrooms and green beans.   They took the food back and didn't remake the food. They warmed it up. Now the medium rare steak wasn't medium rare and the sides were hot but over done.  Ugh.  Here's the problem, if you are going to charge $60 for a steak and $13 for a small bowl of mushrooms and green beans, you should make it the best steak and sides a person could ask for.  Very disappointed!  We paid, tipped well and loved the service but the food-choose some place else.

FEl3TkWy7lv96iUyF9aiNw.text: I've stayed at the Mirage about 5 times now, finally decided to try this place, even though the reviews seemed very mixed. Friend and I were seated on the patio and we ordered pretty quickly. She ordered a medium rare Filet Mignon while I ordered a medium rare Bone-In Ribeye.  Steaks came out pretty quick, or maybe time just flies when you're in Vegas.   Anyways, both steaks looked good from the outside until I started eating more of my ribeye. I started with the thinner parts and it was about medium, which is fine, but it got worst as I got to the thicker parts. Unfortunately we were checked if everything was alright before I started getting to my now well done ribeye.   Somehow the chef was able to cook my steak medium on the thinner parts of the steak and well down on the thicker side. I pretty much lost my appetite after eating half the steak and just wanted to leave. I mean it was so well done that there was almost no blood on the bone. If I'm paying $60 for a ribyeye here, I'd rather go to The Prime and get their dry-aged ribeye for ~$20 more and get a nice view of the fountain. (Although the ribeye there was also pretty bad, but hey, at least I'd get a awesome view!)  My friend's 10oz filet was great though, cooked just right, no complaints about that.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10oz Filet Mignon
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-In Ribeye (USDA choice probably since they only label the NY strip as prime)
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;medium rare&#34; ribeye vs medium rare filet

IhEymNkc3HxMhfEU-D2OPw.text: We were here for a convention and all craving a steak so we decide rather then going elsewhere.... we sat down and the girl got us the menu and took our drink order, first of all... it took forever to get the drinks and we had to ask for bread, they were not busy so no excuse at all, she finally came back after we called he to take our order, I ordered the filet mignon .... it was some $50 for an 8 ounce... well okay it must be very good, we asked that all the dishes get served At the same time so my plate must have been ready first because when I got it..it was COLD...I called the waitress and asked she take it back and warm it, over all a very pricey place that is not worth it, poor service and food is so-so.

xt0d_gEScAv_v-siK-1zxQ.text: We were there for a work party and had excellent service and the food was great!    The shrimp cocktail was really good, prepare yourself for shrimp as big as your hand.    The cheese jalapeno biscuits put red lobsters cheddar biscuits to shame.  I say this with all the love in my heart for red Lobster's biscuits.   The steak itself was a strip steak and mine was cooked perfectly but a few people at the table had ordered their steaks medium and they definitely call me out well done.   Let me tell you about the risotto though, I actually thought that was my favorite part of the meal!  Cooked perfectly, so much flavor and it was just the right amount of creamy!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute little ice cream dessert
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak cooked to perfection

aXRz2xG6vuYyAz54q8hqwQ.text: Great service, very attentive however the food was only warm and had a very unique Smokey flavor. Much better options especially for the price.

4tTBj6pbmzIotmqrOWfFhQ.text: The absolute best filet I have ever eaten in my life. Cooked over white oak. The octopus is a great app. Carlos the lead server made the meal just perfect. I will be back! Too bad Tom Colicchio the owner never comes in to see how well his team performs!

J7lki0RoSe9QheDS5Hqgsg.text: Food was amazing!  Everything we ordered was deliciously on point. The less than perfect service didn't take away from the whole dining experience, and we came away very happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled risotto
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood tower

TPe2FjXZAJi7nTTQ7aou4g.text: Phenomenal experience! We split a wedge salad, New York Strip steak cooked medium rare, added king crab leg, spicy onion rings and baked potato. Every single thing we ate was so yummy and cooked exactly as requested. Our server was Ashley and the bus boy was Jay. Both were exceptionally attentive and polite! We set on the lounge side and enjoyed the scenery of the Mirage foot traffic - the dining area seemed relaxing and quiet.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York strip (split for two), spicy onion rings, king crab leg, baked potato.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OPaD0mCzhTuqybZgZfFcfw.text: The filet mignon was perfectly cooked and well complimented by the oh-so-creamy mashed potatoes and green beans. I was stuffed quickly and couldn't finish most of my plate.  Since I'm still in my first trimester of pregnancy most food and drinks are off limits which sucks. Luckily my body has adapted and turned me off to the smell and taste of alcohol which I once highly desired (especially in Vegas). That being said, my husband ordered a glass of the pinot noir and I took a couple sips. It tasted like heaven in the middle of Sin City!   Service was prompt and waters kept refilled at a good pace (I'm drinking like a camel these days). Great way to start our first night of this Vegas trip.

lbyQlYyuTyyxSx9z-xUcdQ.text: What on earth happened?! The quality of their food sure has gone down.   They should be ashamed to be serving this food.  Run far, far away and save your money.    We've dined here twice before a year ago and both visits were phenomenal.  We were so excited to be dining here again, but this last visit in February 2018 was uncomfortable and was definitely not worth the money.  It's not like we ordered anything different, we ordered the same things - the seafood platter and the A5 Japanese wagyu at $25/oz.  In our previous experiences the A5 wagyu was better than anything we had ever had and we ranted about it to all our friends.  Now we'll have to warn them not to go.    On our most recent visit, the seafood platter was not fresh.  The oysters looked like they could get you sick and the crab legs looked like the worst pickings from a buffet.  The 6 oz. A5 wagyu they served us was mostly fat and very uncomfortable to eat.  I left at least 2 oz ($50!!!) untouched because I couldn't stomach it anymore.  I was close to throwing up.  I think the server knew they were serving not the best quality meat too because he took the dish away without asking any questions to why there was $50 worth of steak untouched.  The sides we ordered were alright, but I came here to eat A5 wagyu steak, not fat.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A5 Japanese Wagyu.  What a waste!  Mostly all fat - I couldn&#39;t finish it.

kZMjaTRqhHX7VPc1s1ikrg.text: We had an amazing meal here on a stay at the Mirage.  Everything was wonderful from booking the reservation through the meal itself.  This restaurant is located in the jungle area of the Mirage.  For being in the middle of a giant casino it is pretty quiet and intimate.  We started with the grilled octopus.  This generous portion had a smokey flavor and was cooked perfectly.  The 10oz filet was one of the better pieces of meat I have had.  The wood oven gives it a distinct earthy flavor. The lobster thermador was also delicious - we were able to share and make our own surf and turf.    Our server was super attentive and literally ran around the restaurant.  Looking back, there was about 5 people waiting on us seamlessly.  The whole meal and presentation of food was first class! Prices were on par with other steakhouses in Vegas.  I look forward to future trips backs here!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing filet
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster thermador
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood grilled octopus

_-9XRYbM9UgOlWl_jKMwXQ.text: We were incredibly excited to try out Heritage Steak.  We were looking for something similar to our other favorite Tom Colicchio restaurant, Craftsteak. Sadly, this did not impress us even in the slightest.  Our dinner was pretty simple and straight forward classics: Wedge salad, Shrimp cocktail, 18oz ribeye w/foie gras accompaniment, and a half lobster thermidor.    The wedge was good and mostly what you would expect, big chunks of Bleu Cheese, crispy bacon, and the right amount of house made dressing.   The shrimp cocktail was borderline "return to sender" as the shrimp were a bit on the soft side of being cooked as well as being a bit colder than room temperature which meant that they smelled fishy and were not enjoyable as a result.  Pair that with the soft texture and it was just a letdown.  The ribeye was your average prime ribeye and I would have preferred to order the dry aged 32oz prime ribeye but that's just plain too much for my wife and I to share. Disappointing for $60 when I could have made it better at home. I added a piece of foie gras that arrived with some chewy bits and was falling apart in its own little cassoulet.  Yet another disappointment when you're beginning to look for something to bring your dinner back on course.   The lobster thermidor was okay.  Nothing to report.   Lastly, let's talk about service.  My wife thought they were okay.  I disagree whole heartedly.  Service in a nutshell was bad.  For any dinner you expect decent timing of everything... our drinks arrived at the same time as our appetizers.  My iced tea was refilled 4-5x but once our complimentary semi fredo arrived (for our anniversary) they disappeared never to be seen again. Furthermore, looking for redemption, when they brought out our complimentary dessert I wanted to order a cappuccino and another dessert.  Our waiter did not return to our table for 10 minutes at which point he finally offered us a dessert menu and/or aperitif. We declined.  At $207 before tip, the cost was similar to craft steak but no where near the quality.  We will not return to Heritage Steak and I would suggest you spend your money elsewhere as well.

vS25fqndGTAuvYD0TBXlkw.text: Overall pretty darn good.  The steaks were cooked well with interesting flavor.  The best part of the meal was the pork belly starter, it's a must.  The worst part was the bone marrow addition to the steak, it's hard to describe why it was so bad, but it was.    Everything else though was worth the price.  Definitely worth checking out.

fnaVYOtNgqlSxUnM7txNqA.text: Food wise I would rate this as a 5! My filet mignon (ordered medium well) was cooked absolutely perfect! Steak was so tender and delicious  I also ordered the Caesar salad which was as fresh as could be. This was the first time I had eaten an actual anchovy but it really enhances the flavor of the salad.  Place is pricey as you order your sides a la carte, but worth the price. The truffle macaroni and cheese was delicious as was the Yukon gold pureed potatoes. The jalepeno bread served with meal was good, but not my favorite as I enjoy a different variety of bread and rolls and also prefer butter with!  Service was exceptional!  Ambiance- would've rather had a little more quiet and privacy to enjoy my meal with my husband. There was a lot going on at the table beside ours which was a little distracting.  This place would be fit for any high level judge to eat at

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9PlFxOXXsb3aFNp1b-8CyA.text: We had a wonderful meal and the service was top notch. Anthony was our waiter and he took extra special care to make our dining experience the best! Try the truffle risotto and creamed spinach for your sides. You won't be disappointed. My filet was perfection. The jalapeno biscuits were a great addition to our meal as well. You can't go wrong with any of their desserts. We try to go to the Mirage for this steakhouse on all our Vegas trips.

zooBXA6bq1W3DEB-9YGPnw.text: We visited twice on our stay at The Mirage.  Let me first say...I am a HUGE fan of Tom Colicchio.  Our past visits to CraftSteak have been LEGENDARY.  Our first visit to Heritage Steak was on the dining side.  Amazingly attentive service and delicious meal.  We loved the biscuits, the salads, the steaks and the dessert.    Tonite we decided to have some food on the lounge side.  Wow, what a different experience.  We sat for 39 minutes between drinks, waited forever for a salad, then forever for a seafood tower.  Waited 20 minutes for a bottle of wine.  It was massively disappointing.  Don't think we will be back.

C9S9kavFi4x5E_2zmyhfuA.text: We just came to Mirage to meet some friends and leave but we were offered dinner here due to my husbands card status which was awesome! The service was phenomenal!   We ordered the following: Seafood platter for 2 $65 which was more than I expected especially having the mini jackpot at the oyster bar the night prior. This was definitely a way better deal! See picture  Beef TarTar so tender, the pickled mushrooms and sauce was amazing this was a meal on its own  16oz dry aged bone I. New York Strip- was so beefy and juicy. Cooked to perfection and melts in your mouth delicious   Truffle risotto- this side dish packed a punch and I'd order this as a meal lol   Spiced onion rings- well this was not good, they looked like soaked in oil and when you bite into one oil was literally dropped all in your face

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips for beef tartar and onion rings both soaked in oil ehh
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle risotto
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged bone in ny strip

wKbpTMSQY0uaFy9ZUT5mPg.text: Absolutely wonderful dining.  Ceasar salad with anchovies were so good.  Lobster bisque yummy.   Steak was perfection and foie gras was perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u045r0x9F40gFBwgiXU6sQ.text: Not good.    My wife had the dry-aged NY.  Ordered med-rare and it got to the table not even rare.  Purple inside and cold.  Unforgivable when everyone the kitchen has a meat thermometer.  We asked them to fix it and it came back 15 minutes later, past well-done and barely edible.  This is a $75 steak.  I asked for med-rare and got rare.  The brussel sprouts were good, but the yukon mash was liquid.  They over crowded it.  Too many tables.  You can't even talk across the table without shouting.  The expediter had a huge beard and no covering on it.  We felt like we had to search through our dinner to make sure there were no hairs in it.  They tried to make it up by overselling desert.  We said no, so the manager brought over a bottle of port to apologize for what had happened with the steak.  My wife likes port and recognized the bottle.  This bottle costs $15 at Trader Joes.  Nice offer but $5 of port doesn't balance out what they did to the steak.  We spent the same amount here we usually spend at Prime in the Bellagio.  They don't compare at all.  Try somewhere else if you want a good experience.

eS971w4ueztHSVK4r3579g.text: Trust me when I tell you you will not need a better steak if you choose the Japanese steak that was $20 an ounce. 4  ounce minimum. Best beef jerky will ever eat. Service was excellent by Mr. Kim. We loved it.

33U4QYEdh40ve3JtYNrFzg.text: This is an example when the Yelp score is not indicative of the food and service this restaurant has to offer. First of all the uniqueness of this restaurant is different from what other steakhouses offer in Las Vegas. The wood-fired grill imparts a special flavor in the steaks offered at this restaurant. I was so happy that I chose to eat here regardless of what others had to say. The steak and service we received was phenomenal and have nothing but good things to say. Service was amazing and I recommend this place to anyone, who can appreciate a fine steak.

LsHwx6JEq4mc81mV0i6T0A.text: Food was a little hit and miss. I had the lobster, my boyfriend had a steak and we shared a side of mushrooms. The mushrooms were AMAZING! So so good.  My lobster was a little chewy. It didn't seem very fresh and maybe a little overcooked. My boyfriend enjoyed his steak, but he said it wasn't the best he's had.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spice Roasted Lobster

rwh-ATQn8QZHo-v3W9tODg.text: Had dinner here on Saturday (10/18) with my family to celebrate my birthday weekend.    Making the reservation was quick and no hassle.    Upon arrival, fifteen minutes early, our hostess seated us immediately without any problem.    There were a few individuals that assisted our table but our main server was James.  I don't remember him introducing himself upon his arrival to our table as he gave us the menus. What gets irritating is he did not come back to our table for over ten minutes - not even to ask what we would like to drink.    For appetizers we ordered Poached Gulf Shrimp and Spanish Salad which we shared, "family style."  Both appetizers were delicious and seasoned perfectly.    For our main course, we ordered Bone-In Rib Eye, Braised Brisket and Roasted Sea Bass.  All three were delicious and each one of is enjoyed the meal.  For sides, we ordered spicy onion rings and risotto.  The Braised Brisket was a favorite and will be ordered again if it's in the menu at the New York restaurant.   Yes, we will visit Tom Colicchio's restaurant in New York this coming December for a birthday weekend.   The meal was delicious but our server, James, lacked service etiquette.  During our meal, he came twice and not once asked if anyone wanted another wine.  The rest of the servers were more helpful than James and one server stands out ( I don't know he's name but he was older who wore glasses). This individual actually came over and ask how our meal was and handed us a copy of the receipt to our meal AND thanked us for coming.    I wished I could give this place more than three stars but service is very important especially in restaurants under a name of someone famous.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised Brisket
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2liExhYQNQoO2YHp6ocFHg.text: Bring a date and order the porterhouse for two. You won't find anything so good anywhere else. Of course, the bone marrow appetizer is pretty awesome, too.    The staff kept checking up on us, so that was nice. We like to feel as though we are getting our money's worth.

O-LkpmCYSBd31kU3vc5zEw.text: What a disappointing steak experience. The meats were not the freshest in Vegas, you could definitely find better steakhouses nearby for the same price. I expected much higher quality steak. I got the Japanese wagyu which should be marbled perfection. I've had quality Kobe beef before, this was not it.   The sides were much better than the steak itself, which is disappointing especially when the restaurant is a steakhouse. The mushrooms were amazingly juicy and flavored well. The bone marrow and lobster were a perfect odd couple--I've never seen the two together before. You can never go wrong with risotto and truffles. The lobster hush puppies were a disappointment; they wet more batter than lobster. Colicchio may benefit from tasting his own menu and spend less time judging others. He definitely has let the quality of this restaurant go. Go for the sides, not the actual steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow with apple slaw and lobster
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4oz Japanese wagyu

2ig4FI8E304gcvRdIsHbcg.text: Great ambiance, great drinks, great service. The steak was subpar at best. Way undercooked, which changed the overall experience.

_DXGlDL_a7MXGapsDtDKiQ.text: Our server, Anthony was amazing. Great attitude. He brought us out cheese bread with beef Jerky. Great concept if it had more flavorful. Menu is straight forward. I went with the bone in ribeye  and it had perfect fat to meat ratio. Ceaser salad was great but big, i would split it. Our sides were potatoes au gratin (amazing but rich,) onion rings (spicy), and risotto my least favorite.  Everything on the menu looked great. I can't wait to go back and order the seafood tower and other cuts of meat and sides. There is a lounge area that looks into the casino and the main dining room was sectioned off. Very modern and sleek. Dim and dark with a blazing fire coming out the open kitchen.  Definitely a 5 star experience.

dGnE7LMko3aHJqjTTWJBDQ.text: This was a great steakhouse experience.  The service was outstanding.  Unique menu and terrific smoked flavor to their meats.  Dessert was an extra special Surprise.  I recommend the ice cream bars which come on dry ice to the table - hand dipped in your choice of chocolates and toppings.

Lp8ONm9CBfeHhzfQQiHngA.text: Ok so I made a huge mistake. I choose to take the boys to eat dinner on 2/4/2017 and it was terrible. First off we sat down for a 8:00pm reservation and was pleased to be seated 5mins earlier. We were greeted quickly and asked for our drink order. We waited about 10mins before we received all of our drinks. And we order our meal apps and entrees together. I noticed a bit of informality with the buss and runners. Just flapping plates on the table. Splashing water into glasses. I also had to ask the buss for bread and butter. He looked at me like "oh you want bread??? I can order it if you want it?" I was like oh you have to order it? He said "it's free don't worry". Like I may not want it if there's a charge. The steaks come out and it's not a $50 steak. I'd eat here if the steaks were $32 with sides. Don't get me wrong... the quality was fine. But I think they're better steakhouses with better service than this. Try Prime at Bellagio. The steaks are great and the lobster is the best I've ever had.   Server was nice  Food was sub par for price.  Buss and runner was sub par

wF1V7g1Z_8NvsG49hnCIRQ.text: Just had our most fantastic meal at Heritage tonight. It started with the wonderful bartenders at the bar while we waited for out table. They helped me figure out the best glass of wine for my taste and were so helpful.   We were then seated and were greeted by our fabulous server, Fazhad (I am sure I am not spelling this correctly, and I apologize for that). He talked us through the menu and helped us make some decisions. The shrimp and buttery salad were delicious. Then we received our entrees. I ordered the lobster and my husband ordered the filet. Both were absolutely fantastic. The steak was so delicious (my husband let me try it) and my lobster was phenomenal. We also ordered the Truffle Risotto which was so good we ate all of it! I have to also mention Sam. He assisted our server and was so nice! He conversed with us and made our experience that much enjoyable.   I honestly cannot say enough good things about this restaurant. We went to a few other restaurants while we have been to Vegas but Heritage, by far, was the best. We have been to Colicchio's Craft restaurant in NY which was also fabulous.   I would always go to one of Tom Colicchio's restaurants if it was an option! He is top notch! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A sweet treat they gave us for celebrating our anniversary.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster!

cuWWC4xtusHULhyPGXizJg.text: Love this restaurant!  Started off with a great selection on the wine list.  Wagyu menu selections were excellently prepared.  Wait staff was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and food preparation styles.

ukm_ijo72j_fQtI-xuyxXw.text: The dining area was a bit too crowded for me.  My chair was practically touching the chair behind me.  Would be nice if the tables were spaced out a bit more.  The decor is nice and modern.  Open air restaurant with no walls.    Service was excellent.  Our waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.  We were suggested a nice Pinot Noir and  everyone was quite happy with the selection, too bad I forgot the name.    We ended up ordering a spice-roasted lobster and the 28 day dry aged Cote de Boeuf 32oz.  The lobster was forgettable.  Nothing really special.  The polenta that accompanied the lobster was pretty good though.    The Cote de Boeuf, however, was a masterpiece.  Cooked perfectly mid-rare, the steak was juicy, full of flavor, and very tender.  Best steak I've had in recent memory.  I have dreams of this steak.  I want one right now!!  The cut of beef is ribeye.  This steak is meant to be shared, but I guess one hungry person can finish the entire steak.    I would recommend this place to anyone who loves steak.  I will be back to try the other cuts of beef, or that is the plan.  I'm not sure if I can pass up on ordering the Cote de Boeuf though.  It was just that good.  If I didn't have that lobster, I may have given this place the full 5 stars on the Cote de Boeuf alone!!

4rd-YVNVSY9fagq3Zvnlpg.text: I wasn't expecting to have the best Margarita I've ever had here but wow to the bartenders who were extremely friendly and talented. Of course incredible steak! Be sure to get the fries.

kPVxKJQnih4ZmI0SCRgs2g.text: I went here with my boyfriend last night, and we both loved it. Was it pricey? Of course...it's a steakhouse in the most over-indulgent city in the country. To be surprised by the prices seems a little crazy to me. Plus, you get what you pay for. We had the grilled oysters as our first course; I'm not a huge oyster fan, but even I'll admit that they were pretty awesome. For my entree, I got the 14oz NY strip with a very large side of Brussels sprouts braised with apple cider vinegar and bacon (seasonal market vegetable) and I couldn't decide which part of the meal I enjoyed more. The steak was well-seasoned, tender, and textbook medium rare. The Brussels sprouts were cooked perfectly (i.e., not mushy) and were so flavorful. He got the 18oz bone-in ribeye and roasted mushrooms, which he enjoyed immensely.   The only thing that was kind of odd was the service. It took our waiter a while to get to us initially, and he was very apologetic, promising that he was going to focus solely on us the rest of the night. We knew that obviously wasn't possible because he had other tables, but at least he was nice about it. But after he took our order, he only came by our table one other time before bringing us our check. We had mixed feelings about this, because on the one hand, we felt a little neglected, but on the other hand, we were able to enjoy our food and each other's company without constantly being asked how our meal was while we had mouths full of food. I think what was off putting was just that it's not what we're used to. That being said, I highly recommend this place.

vCqGuRqU6F-FzeTEYTSsHA.text: Even with the uneven reviews we went  my husband who is a meat eater order the prime rib he said one of the worse prime rib  the popover was so  grease at the price of $58  really it should have been one of the best he said we should have save money and went to outback not in same league !!!  I chose the mushrooms they were good as was the tomato salad we told the waitress she told the manger who came over and offer us desert really I would rather had had a good  memorable meal  save your money try a different  steak house  !!

R2HbUdhcKRh5s-RB51NO3Q.text: They ran out of rib-eye....A steak house. BAD!!!  So so bad.  Only went here for the rave reviews about the rib-eye. Walked out...No class Tom!

rnkMVPry97UTCTh1OBA-vg.text: Very good steakhouse in the Mirage. Hard to stand out in a crowded field of steak joints. Had the prime rib which was close to a Lawry's quality; where Lawry's is 5of5, Heritage is 4.5. Still awesome. Service was a little sketch at times. Sometime we'd have 3 servers surrounding them others couldn't buy a glance from a white coat. Gotta say THE thing that gave this place the 4th star was the Goose Bourbon County on tap and the availability of the 10yr Pappy.  We partook in both. Most excellent and that alone is what made a very good steakhouse stand above the rest.

J0RlU8QTlfupTeZusudwWA.text: We loved the food! The service was excellent. I would give five stars if it wasn't for the loud music. It is not conducive for digestion and it was impossible to have conversation without screaming. That seems to be a trend in the city. Are the employees playing it for themselves? or we are missing something?

V1wIwNLKrJivM5GLCev8wQ.text: Steak was delicious.   Everything else was terrible. Service at the forefront.   They were out of multiple items I wanted ranging from drinks to various food items.   Most offensive was the birthday "cake" I received at the end of the Meal. It was the size of a quarter and I wish I was exaggerating.   Perhaps it is because I am bitter because my party dropped close to $1000 and got terrible service, but the for sure thing is that I will not be returning to this establishment.

FUPRzRcr0l2b1N-kNcMCGQ.text: My husband and I celebrated our mini-honeymoon weekend here! It did not disappoint.  A couple years ago, I ate at Heritage and THAT was my first experience eating at a fancy steakhouse. I was in awe at how amazing of an experience I had and how delicious the food was. So I wanted to bring my husband here as a treat, after our wedding. Since my initial visit, I've been to other steakhouses but Heritage seems to be my most memorable one. It may be because it was my first experience at a steakhouse so I am partial to it or because the food is really that amazing... or maybe both!   The service was exceptional. This is definitely someplace you want to go to celebrate an anniversary or a Valentine dinner *hint hint*. Even though the ambiance may seem a little more luxurious, it really is not too, too fancy. We're not fancy schmancy ourselves and we felt comfortable there.   To top it off, the waitress surprised us with a chocolate cake on the house! As she greeted us we briefly mentioned we were celebrating our recent wedding, and how excited we are to eat here. She remembered and wrote "Congratulations" on the! That really was a WOW moment!

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York Strip steak
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Australian flat iron wagyu steak with chimichurri glaze. Side of mushrooms!

IwsNsa8RkkRaYhojE-EVaw.text: Not ever again.  Wednesday night at 7pm. "Can we start you with a cocktail"? Sure , the wife orders a cocktail and I ordered a craft beer , FROM THEIR BEVERAGE MENU. "Sorry ma'am , we've run out of ingredients for your cocktail , and sir we are currently out of the beer that you ordered"  Round 2 -  We go back to the bevvy menu and re-order. Things get a little better , the wife gets her second choice cocktail , but my second beer choice is also unavailable.  Round 3 Third times the charm. I manage to get my third choice. 2 for 5 is pretty good for a batting average , but not so good for a beverage menu with 15 to 20 items.  Dinner was "fine"??? No complaints but not the greatest either.  Then , to sell the warm fuzzy feeling , they leave my credit card open and add another party's $541.00 bill to my card. I find this out at 8am , while packing to get to the airport. Took 5 days to get bill straight.

9yfyxjUz02pFf_G9p1fKEg.text: First this is not a everyday steakhouse. This steakhouse is in Las Vegas and inside of the Mirage casino. Steaks and other entrees are $$$ prices but it is what you pay for and depending on what your pallet of taste in meats.   It is a experience and well worth it if you are into food. We went in with a group of foodies and people appreciate good food. We had steaks and the steaks are very $$$ cuts and well worth it. I had a 14 oz New York Steak . Fat trim off and cooked perfectly. All the sides are $$$ but we'll worth it with size and taste and quality.   Nice place with a good wine list with a professional wine expert whom there job is to educate wine.   The price is scary but we'll worth it. Special place if your pallete came eat and taste flavour you have never  knew that you have.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YtZbgmT2HvAmDQauGTW7Jw.text: It's almost like the "center bar" of the Mirage, only with really good food.  There's lots of seating options with a huge front bar area and a more formal dining room. Service was great, food was really good... It's a high end chef doing what he knows best and it all works.  I wish there was a better way to separate the main restaurant from the casino as it would add to the ambience considerably.   Outside of that it's easily the best dining option at the Mirage and if you're interested in a great steak cooked over a wood fire grill... this place is tough to beat.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HkuT1yO5Cvm2TdshtmgeUQ.text: Dined last night at Heritage Steak. We had an early dinner before the Beatles Love show. Started with a lot of promise and went downhill. We loved the decor, table was ready at the time of our reservation. While the restaurant was just off the casino floor we were pleasantly surprised at how it wasn't too Smokey. The decor was great, simple but intriguing. I also loved the oversized round 4 tops. Love the bundles of wood around the kitchen. Our server Kim was great he was attentive but not invasive. Water glasses never went empty and we were constantly draining them. Appetizer course was delicious. I enjoyed the wedge salad and my wife enjoyed the arugula salad. My mother loved the cold Lobster salad. They also served some delicious warm cheddar biscuits. Then things took a turn. Entree's were not cooked well. Would we have not been in a hurry to make the Beatles show we would have sent it back. My wife and I split the double cut ribeye and it was over cooked. Bone marrow side saved the day as that was so good. My mother ordered the duck and many parts were tender and delicious but several parts were almost rubbery. Mashed potatoes were very bland. We did enjoy the corn, had a great spicy flavor.  We were surprised at the end with a chocolate/vanilla ice cream treat with sprinkles. That was also good and on the house for our birthday. In this day and age with the variety of options out there I'm not sure you can excuse not preparing the meat to the proper temperature or the rubbery issue with the duck. I can see how this place can get a bad rap on Yelp at that price point and those cooking mistakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double cut ribeye sliced with bone marrow
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula salad

0z4ZDhz_ZmKqD3WElNGk3w.text: Bar service and food was excellent..this is my 2nd visit here, and the restaurant layout is great if you like a nice view of the casino and high energy vibe.. I had the bone in ribeye steak, which was perfectly cooked at medium.  Highly recommended this streak restaurant for its high quality, great seating, and views of the casino floor and people watching.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in Ribeye Steak. Phenomenal.

U0DN2MMpKv8vIevCwY7tyw.text: I was invited here with some friends.   We ordered the seafood tower which was to die for. Then me and a friend shared he scallops and rib eye. They had multiple sides for all of us to share as well.   The food is good but nothing really to die for. I think I enjoyed the onion rings the best. I can't say I would recommend this place nor would I come back on my own. There are lots of great steakhouses in town and this one is just ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey Bread. Very underwhelming.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster Cheesecake.
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Split Ribeye and Scallops.

86368b8aIB7N-yhshrRL4w.text: So we just stopped in for a drinks as we wondered around the Mirage.  Really nice place with top notch bartenders.  They will make you anything you want.    I had an Old fashioned that was very good.  Looking forward to making it back to try the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar
Photo of Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar menu

3Pxe4o5mZghrLWcII078Jw.text: This is a very upscale steakhouse. We were 3 people enjoying a fabulous dinner with super service.   We shared tender rack of lamb and a ribeye steak, creamed spinach, string beans and baked potato. We also had a Caesar salad. Everything was made to perfection.  There were very few people dining when we were there.  It was intimate and memorable.  Decor was classy.  So glad I had the opportunity to eat here in a Tom Colicchio restaurant.
